description.narrative: The equality in action program (Volunteer Cooperation program) is a global capacity building program for local partner organizations delivered mainly through Canadian volunteers and other mechanisms. The program aims to increase the social and economic well beingof the poorest, most marginalized people, especially women and girls. This should be achieved by increasing partners' performance from 13 countries in implementing more inclusive, innovative and sustainable development initiatives that advance gender equalityand inclusive governance. Additionally, the program will increase Canadians participation in international development and key global issues by supporting gender equality, empowerment of women and girls, and inclusive governance throughworking closely with partners and supporting their needs and capacities. Through this program, WAC will create an inclusive Youth Action Lab (YAL) for 50 youngactivists (18-29 years) from the five governorates of the Gaza Strip that would allow youth toaccess resources and support them more sustainable and resilient in their activism during the Covid-19 pandemic. Participants will receive capacity strengthening, peer-to-peer learning, coaching and will work at the grassroots level mobilizing for change around gender equality and civic space. Awareness-raising workshops will be conducted by YAL participants involving Palestinian CSOs in gender equality and civic space, rights to freedom, and inclusive participation.

participating-org.narrative: Women's Affairs Center Gaza Shu'un al Mar'a

The Womens Affairs Centre in Gaza focuses on research and training to promote the equal rights of women in Palestinian society. Itsgoal is to empower women politically, economically and socially and to promote gender awareness in Palestinian society. WAC does this through a program of research, training and lobby to overcome obstacles to the equality of men and women, to analyse and develop tools and strategies for overcoming them. WAC is also involved in activities such as training women to set up and improve small enterprises, in how to use cameras for making videos and films, and in writing and computer skills. The research program is linked to its activities on the themes of child marriages, violence against women and womens rights. WAC has been working in Gaza since 1991 andOxfam Novib has been supporting it since 1992.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services

description.narrative: Increased citizens voice: # of women and men, act as ‘active citizens’: they are organised, participate in decision-making and take collective action for sustainable change in their communities and beyond, up to the global level.
women participating in public events / spaces organized by Oxfam Novib and partners

public events/spaces organised by Oxfam Novib and partners in which citizens express their needs and aspirations to policy makers.
